definition: no use to tell others/let's keep this between ourselves (idiom)
pinyin: bu4 zu2 wei2 wai4 ren2 dao4

definition: lit. don't let one's own fertile water flow into others' field/fig. keep the goodies within the family (proverb)
pinyin: fei2 shui3 bu4 liu2 wai4 ren2 tian2

sentences.english: Further Practice for Pairs ·Add a third speaker and create your own lines.
sentences.chinese: 加進圈外人，創作你們自己的對話。

sentences.english: You don’t have to be the life of the party, but you can’t be a  wallflower.
sentences.chinese: 你不必是聚會的中心，但是你也不能當局外人。

sentences.english: Although she's lived there for ten years, the villagers still treat her as an outsider.
sentences.chinese: 她雖然在那兒住了十年，村裏人仍視她如外人。

sentences.english: It forms a closed territory which rejects "outsiders to go inside" with the boundary of discipline.
sentences.chinese: 以學科爲界限形成一種拒絕“外人入內”封閉地盤。

sentences.english: May the creditor seize all his belongings and strangers plunder the fruits of his toil.
sentences.chinese: 使債主搜刮他所有的家產，使外人劫掠他勞力的所賺。

sentences.english: Do not look down on non-P arty people, for they can master the lessons of our experience very quickly.
sentences.chinese: 不要看不起黨外人士，我們的經驗他們很快就可學會。

sentences.english: But it is publicized by the government for outsiders.
sentences.chinese: 但是政府公開該報告是爲了給外人看的。

sentences.english: It is difficult to believe that I taught anyone anything.
sentences.chinese: 外人很難相信我還會教什麼課程。

sentences.english: FOR as long as humans have romanced each other, others have wanted to meddle.
sentences.chinese: 只要人類存在婚戀行爲，外人就想加以干涉。

sentences.english: It is unwise foranoutsider obtrude his opinions into a family quarrel.
sentences.chinese: 局外人硬把自己的想法加入一場家庭爭論中是不智的。

sentences.english: Thee attachments some enjoy with individuals outside the family circle are enough to carry them through life.
sentences.chinese: 對於家庭圈外人的依屬感貫穿了很多人的一生。

sentences.english: The same law applies to the native-born and to the alien living among you.
sentences.chinese: 本地人和寄居在你們中間的外人同歸一例。

sentences.english: We have in-staff and off-staff members in our units.
sentences.chinese: 我們單位有編內人員和編外人員。

sentences.english: There are no strangers here, please tell the truth.
sentences.chinese: 這裏沒外人，你就說大實話吧。

sentences.english: I am open to trying new things within reason. I like thinking outside the box.
sentences.chinese: 對於新事物，我勇於接受，喜歡以局外人的身份思考。

sentences.english: And they would always prefer to fight inside of their own and they would not like to fight outside.
sentences.chinese: 他們總是寧願在窩裏鬥，而不喜歡跟外人打。

definition: sb with whom one is on familiar terms/sb from the same place (same house, same town etc)/one of us
those on our side/ourselves/one's own people/one of us
always/at all times/never (if used in negative sentence)
to show your face in public (derog.)
(of a person) honorable/not devious/(of a behavior) fair and aboveboard/without tricks/openly/(of a situation) out in the open
to be secretive; to try to cover up (idiom)
